alert.note: Alert for Addison; Caledonia; Chittenden; Lamoille; Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 6:44PM EST until February 19 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Essex County in northern New York... South central Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont... Southwestern Caledonia County in northeastern Vermont... Northwestern Orange County in central Vermont... Northern Addison County in central Vermont... Southern Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... Washington County in central Vermont... * Until 730 PM EST. * At 644 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Stowe to Converse Bay to near North Elba, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Visibility of less than one quarter mile in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 42 and 77. Locations impacted include... Barre, Montpelier, Middlebury, Vergennes, Essex, Moriah, Westport, Elizabethtown, Keene, Waterbury Village, Websterville, Worcester, Middlesex, Marshfield, Addison, Charlotte, Waltham, Bristol, Waitsfield and Fayston. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Addison; Caledonia; Chittenden; Lamoille; Orange; Washington
